headline: Ohio US Senate primary: Business in Russia scrutinized
author: Associated Press
sentences: Editor’s Note: A correction has been made to clarify that the statement included came from the Timken Co. A correction has also been made to a line from the Associated Press to state that Ohio Republican Party Chair Jane Timken’s husband sits on the board of Timken Manufacturing.
CLEVELAND (WJW/AP) – Several Republicans competing for the party’s nomination to run for Ohio’s U.S. Senate seat are being questioned about their ties to Russia.
Nexstar’s Ohio TV stations will host the hour-long debate with candidates Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, Jane Timken, JD Vance and Matt Dolan at 7 p.m. on March 21.
Ohio Republican Party Chair Jane Timken’s husband sits on the board of the like-named Fortune 500 ball bearing manufacturer based in North Canton, Ohio.
Vance and Mike Gibbons also have links to business deals in Russia, according to a report by the Associated Press.
In a statement, the Timken Co.’s spokesperson did not tell FOX 8 when business had been suspended in Russia.
The Timken Co. recently announced it would be suspending operations in Russia do the invasion of Ukraine.
Rob Portman’s seat will square off in a live debate at FOX 8 News in Cleveland.
The candidates are vying for the seat that will be vacated by Sen.
More on how to submit your questions for the debate here.
The five leading Republican candidates vying for Sen.
The primary is scheduled for May 3.
